content.raw:
We’re having a similar problem.  
We run `./run_trial.bash gt-marine-robotics stationkeeping 0 ` and everything appears to work correctly, logs and score are generated.  
Then we run `./generate_trial_video.bash example_team stationkeeping 0`, and it ouputs “creating video directory”, then “found gazebo log file”, and then it hangs there \(we left it to run  for 10 minutes\).

If we run ``roslaunch vrx_gazebo playback.launch log_file:=`pwd`/generated/logs/example_team/stationkeeping/0/gazebo-server/state.log``, then it mostly works and the sensors and batteries are there but the boat is missing as you can see on the picture. VRX is installed on the computer on which the tests were conducted and works fine.  

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/6zzkq96/images/4157679855-image.png)
‌
content.html:
We’re having a similar problem.
We run ./run_trial.bash gt-marine-robotics stationkeeping 0 and everything appears to work correctly, logs and score are generated.
Then we run ./generate_trial_video.bash example_team stationkeeping 0, and it ouputs “creating video directory”, then “found gazebo log file”, and then it hangs there (we left it to run for 10 minutes).

If we run roslaunch vrx_gazebo playback.launch log_file:=`pwd`/generated/logs/example_team/stationkeeping/0/gazebo-server/state.log, then it mostly works and the sensors and batteries are there but the boat is missing as you can see on the picture. VRX is installed on the computer on which the tests were conducted and works fine.

‌
